intro: Teclea utilis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial, often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Teclea utilis prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its ability to produce offsets makes it easy to propagate through stem cuttings.
